headline.main: 164TH TAKES PRIDE IN FEARLESS DEAD; Men Tell of Lieutenants Who Died to Wipe Out Japanese Machine-Gun Nests

lead_paragraph: A PACIFIC BASE, May 1 -- When the 164th Infantry was relieved west of the Matanikau on Dec. 11 and returned to the reserve area near Henderson airfield, it was a tough fighting unit. As Major Gem A.A. Vandegrift of the Marine Corps had said in his farewell message, the 164th had faced without flinching the worst the enemy could do to it and had thrown back the best that he could send.
